info.label: SOA Middleware Administrator, Developer
info.brief: Solving problems with software and a lot of common sense

highlights: Responsible for maintaining 16+ Oracle Fusion Middleware (FMW) clusters

Develop tooling and applications to control, patch, deploy, and maintain various infrastructure products related to FMW systems, such as Oracle Service Bus (OSB), Oracle SOA Suite (SOA), Business Transaction Management (BTM), and Oracle Enterprise Manager - Cloud Control (OEMCC)
Created web service wrapping [Cups4J](http://cups4j.org/), providing asynchronous printing and reporting capabilities for hundreds of daily work orders printed in remote field offices.
Developed application to provide load balancing failover for a Web Services Cluster of WebLogic Servers for patching
Developed over 50 different [Ansible](https://www.ansible.com) Playbooks for fielding diagnostic information, patching, and restarting most infrastructure servers under the ESB/SOA servers.
Active contributor to both [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/users/7008/nick-klauer) and various [Open Source Projects](https://github.com/klauern)

Created training, documentation, and helper libraries for the open source version of [SoapUI](https://www.soapui.org) to assist new developers with SOAP and REST-based service development and testing.  Training included Groovy scripting, JDBC-based testing, and Asynchronous WS-Addressing service call testing.
Maintained and developed trading software and features that were responsible for trading $2B+ annually in Megawatt-Hours (MWh) of electricity.
Developed solution to reduce risk of base-load forecasting by $10,000 / day of missed or incorrectly calculated demand.

history.position: IT Analyst I - Enterprise Application Integration (EAI)
highlights: Software developer for software integrations connecting various software products together with employee, financial, security, and supply chain data.
Developed 30+ integrations using database queries, SOAP-based web services, and extensive use of message-based systems.

history.summary: Bachelor of Science degree focused primarily on embedded systems, software development lifecycle practices, and various algorithm and software development in network, path finding, and data organization.  Capstone project included a multi-semester team-based project.  Led back-end ORM team that provided interface for front-end ASP.NET web-based system to communicate to database.  Processes included software requirements gathering, use case/story building, software development and testing, completed with a presentation to the computer science department.

service.summary: Active member in the United States Army Reserve

history.summary: Currently a Team Leader for Headquarters Company in the 372nd Engineer Company.
highlights: Team Leader responsibilities include inventory, supply, logistics operations

Team Lead for the companyâ€™s intelligence operations during Afghanistan Deployment from May through December 2013.  Responsible for planning route operations, investigating intelligence reports, reporting all company movements and intelligence observations to higher command, and prepared daily and weekly briefs.  Ancillary skill position acquired several months prior to deployment as additional duty

history.summary: Lateral transfer to the Human Relations-side of the Marines, I was primarily involved in writing memorandums, preparing documentation for submittal, and assisted in training several hundred Marines to deploy to Iraq
highlights: Lead multiple teams in physical training activities.
Mentored subordinate Marines in career planning, both for the military path as well as civilian career opportunities.

history.summary: Served in 1st Regiment, 14th Marine Battalion, Charlie Battery.  Deployed to Iraq in 2005-2006 in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom as a convoy escort assitant under 3/14 Hotel Battery
highlights: Deployed to Iraq as part of Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF) in 2006.

testimonials.name: Matthew Bell - Sgt U.S. Army (Ret.)
testimonials.quote: I've known Nick for several years and a tour in Afghanistan. As long as I've known him, Nick has been a hard worker that always completed his tasks in a timely manner. He's very knowledgeable in the software development field and is always looking to expand upon his litany of language knowledge to other coding languages, techniques and best practices.
